column2: FLORIDA DMV TEST
column4: Florida

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Any driver under 21 years of age who is stopped by law enforcement and has a blood alcohol level of __ or higher will automatically have their driving privilege suspended.
2. What does this ‘Soft Shoulder’ sign indicate?
column4: The dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column6: Drivers should leave the pavement immediately.
column8: Drive on the shoulder if you have soft tyres.

column2: 3. When entering an interstate highway, you must:
column4: turn right and stop.
column6: slow down immediately after leaving the acceleration lane.
column8: enter the freeway at a sharp angle if possible.
column10: adjust to freeway speed in the acceleration lane, then signal and move carefully into the freeway lane.

column2: 4. When parking on a public road, drivers should NOT:
column4: set the parking brake and shift to  reverse with a manual transmission.
column6: always check traffic behind them before getting out of the car.
column8: make sure their vehicle cannot move.
column10: leave the keys in their vehicle before leaving it.

column2: 5. When they see a pedestrian with a white cane crossing the street ahead of them, drivers must:
column4: Look for a trained guide dog.
column8: Get out of the car and help that person.

column2: 6. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column8: The driver on the right.
column10: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 7. When leaving an interstate highway, you must:
column4: make a last minute turn if possible.
column6: slow down before turning into the deceleration lane, and check the posted safe speed for the ramp.
column8: increase your speed after turning into the deceleration lane.
column10: slow down as soon as you are off the expressway.

column2: 8. Crossbucks are:
column4: used to indicate railroad crossings.
column8: used to indicate nearby cafes.
column10: pentagonal signs used to indicate school crossings.

column2: 9. Sharrows:
column4: indicate to bicyclists where to ride.
column6: alert drivers that bicyclists may be on the road.
column8: discourage bicycling in the wrong direction.

column2: 10. In Florida, vehicle license plates and registrations must be renewed each year or biennially:
column4: on or before the birthday of the first owner listed on the registration form.
column6: on the day the license plate was obtained.
column8: on or before the day the vehicle was purchased.
column10: on the first day of the year.

column2: 11. The picture shows:
column4: a sign alerting drivers that bicycles may be ahead.
column8: a pavement marking telling bicyclists that they must go straight.

column2: 12. If you are found guilty of racing on the highway, your license must be:
column4: revoked.
column8: terminated.

column2: 13. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column2: 14. On a two-lane road, you should:
column4: yield to trucks.
column6: overtake and pass other vehicles only when a solid yellow line is painted on your side of the center line.
column8: overtake and pass another vehicle only to the left of the vehicle.
column10: keep a minimum following distance of 30 seconds.

column2: 15. At a railroad crossing, if your car stalls on the tracks you should:
column4: keep your seat belt fastened and use your horn if you see a train approaching.
column6: use four-way emergency flashers and call the emergency number.
column8: immediately get yourself and the other passengers out and away from the car.

column2: 16. You are driving a vehicle with automatic transmission. When you park on a hill you should:
column4: shift the transmission into park before setting the parking brake.
column6: turn your wheels so that if your car starts to move, it will roll away from the curb.
column8: set the parking brake before you place automatic gear shift in park.

column2: 17. Tailgating trucks is particularly dangerous because:
column4: unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots directly behind them.
column8: truck need to swing wide to the left in order to safely negotiate a right turn.
column10: most trucks have several rearview mirrors.

column2: 18. What should you do when the gas pedal is jammed?
column4: Get all passengers out on the side away from traffic.
column8: Keep your eyes on the road.

column2: 19. Parking lights must __________ on any vehicle parked on a roadway outside of cities and towns.
column4: be used at night
column8: always be turned off

column2: 20. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column6: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column8: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column10: steer the car into the direction of the skid.

column2: 21. Drivers convicted of running a red light:
column4: need to stop at green lights for 90 days.
column6: are required to complete a basic driver improvement course.
column8: will automatically have their driving privilege suspended for 6 months.
column10: need to spend 15 days in jail.

column2: 22. Controlled substances do NOT include:
column4: Depressants
column8: Alcohol

column2: 23. The yield sign means:
column4: Stop if you can.
column6: Go. The light will soon be red.
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 24. If another vehicle is passing you on the left-hand side of the road, you should:
column4: honk your horn.
column8: move to the rightmost lane.
column10: allow the other vehicle to pass safely.

column2: 25. Under the The No-Fault Law, you must maintain insurance coverage:
column4: for 5 years.
column8: throughout the vehicle registration period.

column2: 26. What does this ‘DIP’ sign indicate?
column4: Downgrade ahead. Drivers should go slowly.
column8: There is a Drive-In Parking ahead.
column10: There is a low place in the road.

column2: 27. The inside temperature of a vehicle can rise almost __ degrees within the first __ minutes with no ventilation.
28. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: low-beam lights.
column8: parking lights.

column2: 29. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a reduction of lanes.
column6: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column8: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 30. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: All of the above.
column6: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column8: chasing or challenging other drivers.
column10: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 31. At an open intersection, drivers have the right-of-way if:
column4: they are driving faster than the other vehicles.
column6: they are already in the intersection.
column8: they enter a paved road from an unpaved road.

column2: 32. What is the maximum speed limit in a residential area if there is no speed limit sign?
column4: 20 MPH.
column8: 35 MPH

column2: 33. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 34. If an officer thinks that you are under the influence of alcohol or drugs:
column4: your license will automatically be suspended for 1 year.
column6: you have the right to you refuse to take any test.
column8: he may send you to jail.
column10: you will be asked to take a blood test, a urine test, or a breath test.

column2: 35. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.

column2: 36. Vehicles must have at least one rearview mirror which gives a view of the highway at least ___ feet to the rear.
37. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the steering ability.
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 38. Which of the following is true about double solid yellow lines?
column4: Drivers may travel in the same direction on both sides of this line.
column6: Vehicles may cross these lines temporarily when passing is safe.
column8: Drivers may not cross these lines unless turning left when it’s safe to do so.

column2: 39. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: warn drivers.

column2: 40. Parking is not allowed within __ feet of the entrance to an ambulance station
41. Lane signals are used:
column4: to show when pedestrians may begin crossing the street.
column6: to alert drivers to a warning sign.
column8: to show which lanes are opened or closed.

column2: 42. This sign means:
column4: The traffic signal is not operational
column8: No traffic signal ahead

column2: 43. The seat belt law applies to passenger cars manufactured beginning with the ____ model year.
44. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column6: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column8: Apply the parking brake slowly.

column2: 45. This road sign is:
column4: a warning sign.
column8: a guide sign.

column2: 46. Controlled substances include:
column4: marijuana
column8: alcoholic beverages

column2: 47. Can you pass a school bus when it displays a stopped signal?
column4: Yes, but you must slow down and prepare to stop.
column6: Yes, but you cannot exceed 30 MPH.
column8: No, you must come to a complete stop.
column10: Yes, but you need to signal your intention to pass.

column2: 48. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: that there's a school zone ahead.
column8: the direction they should travel.

column2: 49. Left lanes on some interstate roads are reserved for:
column4: pedestrians.
column8: large trucks.

column2: 50. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column8: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
